Spherical caps in cell polarization

27 Feb 2018

I have just submitted a paper about the modelling of embrygonesis with the Shvartsman group at Princeton University. Let me review the main ideas of our work.

We proposed a new model for the formation of polarized patterns observed in early embryogenesis of C. elegans where mass conservation is the driving force. In our model, a species moves freely in a cell and reversibly adheres to the cell membrane . The membrane-bound species diffuses on the surface and recruits more of itself to the membrane.
